name: LockedIn
description: An NFC-powered app blocker that helps users achieve digital wellbeing and productivity by blocking distracting apps

userStories.title: Material Design 3 Dark Theme UI Setup
userStories.description: As a user, I want a clean, dark-themed interface so that the app is visually appealing and easy on the eyes.
acceptanceCriteria: App uses Material Design 3 components throughout
Dark theme is the default and only theme
UI is simple and functional with minimal decoration
Typography follows Material 3 guidelines
All screens are consistent in visual style
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Room Database Setup for Settings and Block List
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to set up Room database to store settings, block list, and statistics so that data persists across app restarts.
acceptanceCriteria: Room database is configured with appropriate entities
Entity for blocked apps list
Entity for schedule configuration
Entity for statistics and session tracking
DAOs created for all entities
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: App Selection Screen
userStories.description: As a new user, I want to select apps to block from a checklist of all installed apps so that I can configure which apps will be blocked.
acceptanceCriteria: All installed apps shown in alphabetical checklist
Apps can be checked/unchecked to add/remove from block list
System apps can optionally be shown/hidden
Selected apps are persisted to Room database
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Schedule Configuration Screen
userStories.description: As a user, I want to configure my blocking schedule in the app settings so that NFC activation uses my preferred time window.
acceptanceCriteria: User can set start time and end time for the schedule
Schedule is saved and persists across app restarts
Validation prevents invalid schedules (end time must be after start time)
Schedule stored in Room database
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Accessibility Service Permission Flow
userStories.description: As a new user, I want to be prompted to grant Accessibility Service permission with clear explanation so that the app can detect blocked apps.
acceptanceCriteria: User is prompted to grant Accessibility Service permission with clear explanation of why it's needed
Setup cannot be completed without granting Accessibility permission
Permission status is checked and displayed
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: First-Time Setup Flow
userStories.description: As a new user, I want to complete initial setup with permissions and app selection so that LockedIn is ready to use with my NFC tag.
acceptanceCriteria: Setup wizard guides through permission grant, app selection, and schedule configuration
Setup cannot be completed without granting Accessibility permission
User sees confirmation when setup is complete
Setup state is persisted so it only shows once
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Accessibility Service for Blocked App Detection
userStories.description: As a user, I want the app to reliably detect when I open blocked apps so that blocking works consistently.
acceptanceCriteria: Accessibility Service monitors foreground app changes
Detection works for all apps in the block list
Service runs reliably in background without being killed
Service automatically restarts if killed by system
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: NFC Tag Receiver
userStories.description: As a user, I want to tap my NFC tag to instantly activate my pre-configured blocking schedule so that I can start my focus session.
acceptanceCriteria: App registers to receive NFC intents even when not in foreground
Tapping NFC tag activates the pre-configured schedule immediately
User receives haptic feedback and/or toast confirmation on activation
Works with any standard NFC tag (no special encoding required)
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Blocking State Manager and Foreground Service
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a foreground service to maintain blocking state so that blocking persists reliably.
acceptanceCriteria: Foreground service maintains blocking state
Blocking becomes active within 1 second of NFC tap
Service keeps track of schedule end time
Blocking state is accessible to other components
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Lock Screen Overlay
userStories.description: As a user with active blocking, I want to see a lock screen overlay when I try to open a blocked app so that I'm reminded of my commitment.
acceptanceCriteria: When a blocked app is detected in foreground, overlay appears within 500ms
Overlay displays message: This app is currently blocked
Overlay shows countdown timer with time remaining until schedule ends
Overlay covers the entire screen and cannot be dismissed by back button
Blocked app is sent to background when overlay appears
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Persistent Notification During Blocking
userStories.description: As a user with active blocking, I want to see a persistent notification showing my remaining time so that I always know my focus session status.
acceptanceCriteria: Notification appears when blocking is activated
Notification shows remaining time, updated every minute
Notification displays quick stat (e.g., 3 apps blocked)
Notification cannot be dismissed while blocking is active
Notification is removed when blocking ends
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: NFC Tap While Blocking Active - Dialog
userStories.description: As a user with active blocking, I want to tap NFC and see my remaining time with options to extend or end so that I can adjust my focus session.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping NFC while blocking is active shows a dialog/screen
Dialog displays remaining time in the current session
User can choose to Extend (add more time) or End Now
If user chooses Extend, they can add preset durations (30m, 1h, 2h)
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Double-Tap NFC Confirmation to End Blocking
userStories.description: As a user, I want to tap NFC again to confirm ending my blocking session so that I don't accidentally unblock.
acceptanceCriteria: If user chooses End Now, they must tap NFC again to confirm (preventing accidental unblock)
Confirmation message is displayed prompting for second tap
Blocking ends only after second NFC tap confirmation
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Blocking Reset on Phone Restart
userStories.description: As a user, I want blocking to reset to OFF when my phone restarts so that I must intentionally tap NFC to re-enable focus mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Blocking state is cleared on device boot
User must tap NFC to start a new blocking session after restart
Any active schedule is cancelled on restart
Notification is cleared on restart
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Session Statistics Tracking
userStories.description: As a user, I want the app to track my focus session statistics so that I can monitor my progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Track number of blocked app open attempts per session
Calculate and store time saved based on blocked attempts
Stats persist across app updates and are stored locally
Stats from interrupted session are still recorded
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Statistics Display Screen
userStories.description: As a user, I want to view detailed statistics about my focus sessions so that I can track my progress and stay motivated.
acceptanceCriteria: Display time saved based on blocked attempts
Show daily and weekly trend graphs
Display blocked app attempts count
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Streak Counter and Display
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see my current streak prominently displayed so that I'm motivated to maintain my focus habits.
acceptanceCriteria: Streak counter shown on main screen
Streak increments when a full scheduled session is completed
Streak resets if a day passes without completing a session
Visual celebration when streak milestones are reached (7, 30, 100 days)
Streak history is preserved in statistics
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: App Selection Management in Settings
userStories.description: As a user, I want to modify my blocked apps list from settings so that I can adjust which apps are blocked over time.
acceptanceCriteria: User can access app selection from settings menu
Currently blocked apps are shown as checked
Changes can only be made when blocking is not active
./gradlew build passes

userStories.title: Schedule Modification Restrictions
userStories.description: As a user, I want schedule modification to be blocked while a session is active so that I can't bypass my commitment.
acceptanceCriteria: User can modify schedule at any time when blocking is not active
Schedule cannot be modified while blocking is active
UI shows disabled state with explanation when blocking is active
./gradlew build passes
